ACT
85
Exclusion of necessary heirs and reasons for exclusion
The testator may exclude from the inheritance an heir who is entitled to a necessary share:
1) if, by violating some legal or moral obligation arising from his family relationship with the testator, he has committed a grave sin against the testator,
2) if he intentionally committed a serious crime against him or his spouse, child or parent,
3) if he committed a criminal offense against the Republic of Croatia or values protected by international law,
4) if he indulged in idleness or dishonest life.
Exclusion from inheritance can be complete or partial.
